Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..case_name: Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co.
Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..support_reasoning: The proposition claims that Palsgraf is being cited as part of a set of statutes, rules, restatement provisions, and authoritative decisions specifically relevant to negligence law and procedure in Massachusetts. Palsgraf is a New York Court of Appeals decision articulating general common-law duty and foreseeability principles, not Massachusetts-specific statutes, rules, or procedural doctrines. While influential generally, it does not itself address Massachusetts law or procedure, so it does not support the proposition as phrased.
Palsgraf v. Long Island R.R. Co., 248 N..relevant_excerpt: Negligence is not actionable unless it involves the invasion of a legally protected interest, the violation of a right. "Proof of negligence in the air, so to speak, will not do" ... "In every instance, before negligence can be predicated of a given act, back of the act must be sought and found a duty to the individual complaining, the observance of which would have averted or avoided the injury."

Mass. R. Civ. P. 4.proposition: Serve the Defendant in accordance with Mass. R. Civ. P. 4 and applicable Massachusetts statutes.
